analysis.Summary: This file defines and exports the Vue Router route configuration for the "backoffice" section of the application, including its root path, child routes, metadata, and access control middleware.
analysis.Purpose: To centralize and declare all routing rules, dynamic component imports, and access guards for the backoffice/admin area in a martyrs-based Vue.js project.

Components.name: backofficeRoutes
Components.responsibility: Holds the root route configuration for '/backoffice', including metadata, props, beforeEnter guards, and child routes.

Functions.name: validationAuth.requiresAdmin
Functions.purpose: Route guard middleware ensuring only users with admin roles can enter the backoffice routes.

Functions.name: component loader functions
Functions.purpose: Dynamically import and lazy-load the Vue components for each child route when the route is visited.

Dependencies.purpose: Dashboard view for the base backoffice route

analysis.Usage: Imported into the main Vue Router setup (e.g., src/router/index.js) and included in the routes array to activate the backoffice navigation and guards.
Notes: Contains a commented‐out 'admin' sub‐route block, possibly for future expansion.
Uses webpackChunkName hints for better chunk naming on dynamic imports.
Props for the route include a placeholder 'newsletterPopup' value (12344); likely for demonstration or future use.
Meta fields manage localized titles and sidebar configuration (component & width).
